refnamediv.refpurpose: A widget that creates a signal when clicked on

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkButton widget is generally used to attach a function to that is called when the button is pressed. The various signals and how to use them are outlined below.
The GtkButton widget can hold any valid child widget. That is it can hold most any other standard GtkWidget. The most commonly used child is the GtkLabel.

refsect2.title: GtkButton
refsect2.para: This should not be accessed directly. Use the accessor functions below.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkButton widget. To add a child widget to the button, use gtk_container_add().

listitem.simpara: The newly created GtkButton widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_new_with_label ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GtkButton widget with a GtkLabel child containing the given text.

listitem.simpara: The text you want the GtkLabel to hold.
The newly created GtkButton widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_new_with_mnemonic ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkButton containing a label. If characters in label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use '__' (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic. Pressing Alt and that key activates the button.

listitem.simpara: The text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character
a new GtkButton

refsect2.title: gtk_button_new_from_stock ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkButton containing the image and text from a stock item. Some stock ids have preprocessor macros like GTK_STOCK_OK and GTK_STOCK_APPLY.
If stock_id is unknown, then it will be treated as a mnemonic label (as for gtk_button_new_with_mnemonic()).

listitem.simpara: the name of the stock item
a new GtkButton

refsect2.title: gtk_button_pressed ()
refsect2.para: Emits a "pressed" signal to the given GtkButton.

listitem.simpara: The GtkButton you want to send the signal to.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_released ()
refsect2.para: Emits a "released" signal to the given GtkButton.

listitem.simpara: The GtkButton you want to send the signal to.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_clicked ()
refsect2.para: Emits a "clicked" signal to the given GtkButton.

listitem.simpara: The GtkButton you want to send the signal to.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_enter ()
refsect2.para: Emits a "enter" signal to the given GtkButton.

listitem.simpara: The GtkButton you want to send the signal to.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_leave ()
refsect2.para: Emits a "leave" signal to the given GtkButton.

listitem.simpara: The GtkButton you want to send the signal to.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_set_relief ()
refsect2.para: Sets the relief style of the edges of the given GtkButton widget. Three styles exist, GTK_RELIEF_NORMAL, GTK_RELIEF_HALF, GTK_RELIEF_NONE. The default style is, as one can guess, GTK_RELIEF_NORMAL.

listitem.simpara: The GtkButton you want to set relief styles of.
The GtkReliefStyle as described above.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_get_relief ()
refsect2.para: Returns the current relief style of the given GtkButton.

listitem.simpara: The GtkButton you want the GtkReliefStyle from.
The current GtkReliefStyle

refsect2.title: gtk_button_get_label ()
refsect2.para: Fetches the text from the label of the button, as set by gtk_button_set_label(). If the label text has not been set the return value will be NULL. This will be the case if you create an empty button with gtk_button_new() to use as a container.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
The text of the label widget. This string is owned by the widget and must not be modified or freed.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_set_label ()
refsect2.para: Sets the text of the label of the button to str. This text is also used to select the stock item if gtk_button_set_use_stock() is used.
This will also clear any previously set labels.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
a string

refsect2.title: gtk_button_get_use_stock ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the button label is a stock item.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
TRUE if the button label is used to select a stock item instead of being used directly as the label text.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_set_use_stock ()
refsect2.para: If TRUE, the label set on the button is used as a stock id to select the stock item for the button.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
TRUE if the button should use a stock item

refsect2.title: gtk_button_get_use_underline ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether an embedded underline in the button label indicates a mnemonic. See gtk_button_set_use_underline().

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
TRUE if an embedded underline in the button label indicates the mnemonic accelerator keys.

refsect2.title: gtk_button_set_use_underline ()
refsect2.para: If true, an underline in the text of the button label indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

refsect2.title: gtk_button_set_focus_on_click ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the button will grab focus when it is clicked with the mouse. Making mouse clicks not grab focus is useful in places like toolbars where you don't want the keyboard focus removed from the main area of the application.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
whether the button grabs focus when clicked with the mouse

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_button_get_focus_on_click ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the button grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse. See gtk_button_set_focus_on_click().

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
TRUE if the button grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_button_set_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the alignment of the child. This property has no effect unless the child is a GtkMisc or a GtkAligment.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
the horizontal position of the child, 0.0 is left aligned, 1.0 is right aligned
the vertical position of the child, 0.0 is top aligned, 1.0 is bottom aligned

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_button_get_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Gets the alignment of the child in the button.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
return location for horizontal alignment
return location for vertical alignment

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_button_set_image ()
refsect2.para: Set the image of button to the given widget. Note that it depends on the "gtk-button-images" setting whether the image will be displayed or not, you don't have to call gtk_widget_show() on image yourself.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
a widget to set as the image for the button

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_button_get_image ()
refsect2.para: Gets the widget that is currenty set as the image of button. This may have been explicitly set by gtk_button_set_image() or constructed by gtk_button_new_from_stock().

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
a GtkWidget or NULL in case there is no image

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_button_set_image_position ()
refsect2.para: Sets the position of the image relative to the text inside the button.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
the position

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_button_get_image_position ()
refsect2.para: Gets the position of the image relative to the text inside the button.

listitem.simpara: a GtkButton
the position

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "focus-on-click" property
refsect2.para: Whether the button grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "image" property
refsect2.para: Child widget to appear next to the button text.

refsect2.title: The "image-position" property
refsect2.para: The position of the image relative to the text inside the button.
Default value: GTK_POS_LEFT
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "label" property
refsect2.para: Text of the label widget inside the button, if the button contains a label widget.
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The "relief" property
refsect2.para: The border relief style.
Default value: GTK_RELIEF_NORMAL

refsect2.title: The "use-stock" property
refsect2.para: If set, the label is used to pick a stock item instead of being displayed.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "use-underline" property
refsect2.para: If set, an underline in the text indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "xalign" property
refsect2.para: If the child of the button is a GtkMisc or GtkAlignment, this property can be used to control it's horizontal alignment. 0.0 is left aligned, 1.0 is right aligned.
Allowed values: [0,1]
Default value: 0.5
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The "yalign" property
refsect2.para: If the child of the button is a GtkMisc or GtkAlignment, this property can be used to control it's vertical alignment. 0.0 is top aligned, 1.0 is bottom aligned.
Allowed values: [0,1]
Default value: 0.5
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The "child-displacement-x" style property
refsect2.para: How far in the x direction to move the child when the button is depressed.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "child-displacement-y" style property
refsect2.para: How far in the y direction to move the child when the button is depressed.
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "default-border" style property
refsect2.para: Extra space to add for CAN_DEFAULT buttons.

refsect2.title: The "default-outside-border" style property
refsect2.para: Extra space to add for CAN_DEFAULT buttons that is always drawn outside the border.

refsect2.title: The "displace-focus" style property
refsect2.para: Whether the child_displacement_x/child_displacement_y properties should also affect the focus rectangle.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The "image-spacing" style property
refsect2.para: Spacing in pixels between the image and label.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 2

refsect2.title: The "inner-border" style property
refsect2.para: Sets the border between the button edges and child.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "activate" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkButton *widget, gpointer user_data) : Run First / Action
refsect2.para: The ::activate signal on GtkButton is an action signal and emitting it causes the button to animate press then release. Applications should never connect to this signal, but use the "clicked" signal.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "clicked" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkButton *button, gpointer user_data) : Run First / Action
refsect2.para: Emitted when the button has been activated (pressed and released).

listitem.simpara: the object that received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkButton *button, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: Emitted when the pointer enters the button.

listitem.simpara: the object that received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "leave" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkButton *button, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: Emitted when the pointer leaves the button.

listitem.simpara: the object that received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkButton *button, gpointer user_data) : Run First

refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkButton *button, gpointer user_data) : Run First
